solution_line_template: Susan needs to make {num_guests}/{servings_per_batch}=<<{num_guests}/{servings_per_batch}={num_batches}>>{num_batches} batches of the recipe.
She will also need {teaspoons_salt_per_batch}*{num_batches}=<<{teaspoons_salt_per_batch}*{num_batches}={total_teaspoons_salt_needed}>>{total_teaspoons_salt_needed} teaspoons of salt.

Thus she will have to buy {total_teaspoons_salt_needed}/{teaspoons_per_container}=<<{total_teaspoons_salt_needed}/{teaspoons_per_container}={num_salt_containers}>>{num_salt_containers} containers of salt.

Therefore, she will spend {total_potatoes_needed}*$.{cost_per_potato_display}=${cost_potatoes} on potatoes and {num_salt_containers}*${cost_per_salt_container}=<<{num_salt_containers}*{cost_per_salt_container}={cost_salt}>>${cost_salt} on salt.
Thus, she will spend ${cost_potatoes}+${cost_salt}=<<{cost_potatoes}+{cost_salt}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost} on food.
